intro: Coniogramme jinggangshanensis, commonly known as the Jinggangshan coniogramme, is a rare fern species native to China. It belongs to the family Athyriaceae and is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped fronds. The plant exhibits a unique morphology with finely divided leaves that form a dense, feathery appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in mountainous regions with high humidity. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
